title: Northern Mariana Islands Senate
text:
The Northern Mariana Islands Senate is the upper house of the <a href="Northern%20Mariana%20Islands%20Commonwealth%20Legislature">Northern Mariana Islands Commonwealth Legislature</a>. The Senate consists of nine senators representing three senatorial districts (<a href="Saipan">Saipan</a> & <a href="Northern%20Islands%20Municipality">the Northern Islands</a>, <a href="Tinian">Tinian</a> & <a href="Aguijan">Aguijan</a>, and <a href="Rota%20%28island%29">Rota</a>), each a multi-member constituency with three senators.
In the November 2007 elections, the three senators up for re-election were all re-elected to another four-year term in the 16th and 17th Senate. The <a href="Covenant%20Party%20%28Northern%20Mariana%20Islands%29">Covenant Party</a>, which lost control of the <a href="Northern%20Mariana%20Islands%20House%20of%20Representatives">House</a>, entered into <a href="coalition">coalition</a> with the <a href="Democratic%20Party%20%28United%20States%29">Democrats</a> and a lone <a href="Independent%20%28politician%29">Independent</a> over the Senate's leadership and voting agenda.
The CNMI Senate was controlled in 2016 by a Republican majority under <a href="List%20of%20Presidents%20of%20the%20Senate%20of%20the%20Northern%20Mariana%20Islands">Senate President</a> Franciso Borja.
<a href="Maria%20Frica%20Pangelinan">Maria Frica Pangelinan</a> was the first woman to serve in the Senate.
